data.title: emmylou harris performing “you never can tell (c’est la vie)” on toppop, 1977⭐️🥀🔮 emmylou harris was born in birmingham, alabama on april...
data.meta_description:
70sdesperado on March 12, 2024: "emmylou harris performing “you never can tell (c’est la vie)” on toppop, 1977⭐️🥀🔮
emmylou harris was born in birmingham, alabama on april 2nd, 1947.
during her high school years, emmylou & her family moved to woodbridge, virginia due to her father being a marine corps officer. in 1965, emmylou graduated as her class’ valedictorian. after high school, she planned on being an actress & received a drama scholarship. in 1967, she would drop out of college & focus on pursuing music as a folk singer. around 1970 she moved to moved to washington, d.c. with her parents & daughter due to financial struggles. while in washington, d.c. emmylou gained a following from performing at clubs. yet, she was unconvinced she could make it as a music artist. 
around that same time, gram parsons was looking for a harmony singer. one of gram’s friends heard about emmylou from a conversation her daughter’s babysitter was having. they soon got in contact with emmylou & a year later, he sent her a plane ticket to los angeles, california where she recorded harmony vocals for gram’s debut album g.p. emmylou began to tour with gram & found a love for country music.
In 1973, emmylou returned to the recording studio to make gram’s next album titled grievous angel. only a few weeks later gram passed away due to a heroin overdose. after gram’s passing linda ronstadt, who befriended emmylou around the same time, let emmylou stay at her house while she grieved. emmylou decided to continue with music & carry on the country rock legacy left by gram for her own career. in 1975, she released her first solo album “pieces of the sky”. the album was a commercial success & she’d release another album “elite hotel” soon after. in 1976, emmylou released her album “luxury liner” which was her second number one american country album & her second to make the top twenty in the uk.
around 1979, emmylou’s record label proposed shifting towards country pop, which she didn’t do & instead recorded two traditionally-oriented albums, “blue kentucky girl” & “roses in the snow”.".
